title: Hurricane Melissa leaves 29 dead as category 2 storm heads towards Bermuda – live
summary: Jamaica, Haiti, and Cuba are evaluating the damage caused by recent storms, while residents of Bermuda prepare for the arrival of a downgraded storm. The affected countries are focusing on recovery efforts amid ongoing challenges. Meanwhile, Bermudans are taking precautions as the storm approaches.

title: UN leaders condemn ‘horrifying’ mass killings in Sudan
summary: An emergency UN Security Council session condemned the recent killings of civilians in El Fasher. The council also criticized the external supply of arms to the Rapid Support Forces (RSF). The discussions aimed to address escalating violence and protect human rights in the region.

title: Senate passes bill to nullify Trump’s sweeping global tariffs on more than 100 nations – US politics live
summary: The Senate approved a bipartisan bill to end tariffs with a vote of 51-47. This follows the recent passage of resolutions to repeal tariffs on Canada and Brazil. The move aims to enhance trade relations and reduce costs for consumers.

title: OpenAI thought to be preparing for $1tn stock market float
summary: The developer of ChatGPT is reportedly exploring the possibility of an initial public offering (IPO) set for the second half of 2026. This move could signal the company's growth ambitions and increasing market interest. More details are expected as plans progress.

title: Reeves says she should have checked rental licence had been obtained as letting agent apologises – UK politics live
summary: No 10 has published redacted emails exchanged between the husband of Labour's shadow chancellor, Rachel Reeves, and a letting agent. The release aims to address transparency concerns surrounding the financial dealings of opposition politicians. The emails have been subject to redaction to protect personal information.
